title: Condensed Grotesque "Beats!"
content:
Could anyone help me with this one?   
   
Thanks..   
   
 ![merseysound.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20141030072313im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/4723.jpg)
author: tidsfrist

comments.content: Hmmm... Haven't got an exact match, but I don't know if you've already checked stuff like [Compacta](http://web.archive.org/web/20141030072313/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/compacta/) or [Helvetica Compressed](http://web.archive.org/web/20141030072313/http:/www.adobe.com/type/browser/P/P_050.jhtml). Those are the most obvious of course, there are quite a few more.
It's a bit more off, but [this](http://web.archive.org/web/20141030072313/http:/www.typography.com/catalog/knockout/index.html) is a real knock-out.

I really liked Knockout. That will work.   
Thanks for the tip.
You'd better be. This is the raw expression or rock'n'roll unchained. Imagine this very sight times four, accompanied by ripping guitar riffs, a thumping bass and thunderous drum rolls. Wickid!

Yves, I think your picture is working very well now... :-)   
   
hhp

Looks like any ol generic Gothic Condensed woodtype junk to me. And I'd guess original. Not often easy to identify specifically as many of the specimens from the various 19th c. American manufacturers were destroyed as Hamilton took them over. But I'd assume this was printed in England?

Knockout _is_ great. Typophile uses it all over this site.   
  
Here are some other ultra condensed grots:   
  
 [Bureau Grotesque](http://web.archive.org/web/20141030072313/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/bureau-grotesque/bureaugrotesque-onethree/)  
 [Hanseatic](http://web.archive.org/web/20141030072313/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/hanseatic/)  
 [Roswell](http://web.archive.org/web/20141030072313/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/roswell-four-itc/roswell-four-itc/)  
 [Grotesque MT Extra](http://web.archive.org/web/20141030072313/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/grotesque-mt/extra-condensed/)  
  
Yves - I liked your old pic better. Now I'm really frightened.
